section.title: Maintaining card types

subsection.title: Navigate to the Card types page

steps.item: Sign in to Mingle as a project administrator and open the project (if you're not already working in the project).

item.p: Mingle displays the Project settings page.
item.note: if you are logged in as a project team member, Mingle displays the Team page.

screenshot.alttext: Project admin menu - Card types link

item.p: Mingle displays the Card types page with all card types setup for this project.

screenshot.alttext: Card types page - new card type
Card types page - new card type

section.subsection: Card types can be colored. Color will be used to differentiate cards in the grid and tree views.

subsection.title: Reorder card types
subsection.p: You can change the order in which card types are displayed in the filters and quick add.
Click on the Drag links next to the types you want to re-order and drag them into the correct order.

subsection.title: Editing and deleting card types
subsection.p: The card type page looks and works similarly to the card property page. Use the edit and delete links to edit existing card types.
subsection.note: You can only delete a card type if it is not used by any card, including old versions of a card, in your project.

subsection.title: Add or remove properties
subsection.p: You can add or remove properties from a card type, click the Edit link and add or remove properties using the checkboxes next to the property names
subsection.warning: If you remove properties from a card type, then any data that was held in those properties is lost.

subsection.title: Maintain card defaults
subsection.p: Click on the Edit defaults link to specify default property values for the card type.

item.p: Click the Create new card type link.
Mingle displays the New card type page.

bullets.item: Enter a name for the new card type
Choose a reporting color for the new card type. This color will be used to differentiate cards in the grid and tree views

item.p: Select which card properties should apply to the new card type
Click on the Create type link to save your work.
